column5: The MSc in Human Computer Interaction is a one-year taught programme run by the School of Computer Science. Much of the core content is delivered by members of the St Andrews Human Computer Interaction (SACHI) research group.The course consists of two semesters of taught components followed by an 11-week project leading to the submission of a 15,000-word dissertation in August.
column7: St Andrews Human Computer Interaction (SACHI) research group
column9: One year full time or two years part time
